content.description: For a short route this route has a lot going on in it. Sit start with your right hand on the right arete, and left pinching the left arete. Heel hook on the jug by the tree with your right foot and left foot on a foot on the face. Pull up and make awkward moves surmounting the short overhung face, moving over to the less than vertical part is the crux. If this route went on for another ten feet it would be  classic but because of its shortness, it will never be.
content.location: This route is in Munchkin Land. Munchkin Land is to the right ( if you are looking from the road) of the main part of the pound. The best way to get to this problem is by walking to Smoke and Mirrors (V6) then looking past it to the left about forty feet from there you will see a small arete boulder this is the Gary's Fortune.

content.description: The crux of this route is pulling off the ground. To do this you use a slopey arete with your left hand and a crimp that is at a weird angle with your right. Heel hook around the arete with your left foot  and with your right foot use the outside of your foot on a small hold just right of the arete. From this awkward feeling position stand up bringing your right hand to a small rounded crimp out right on the right face, then move your left hand up the arete to a good pinch, then adjust your feet and go to the huge topout.
content.protection: Pad and watch out for the rock behind you.
content.location: In Munchkin Land, go to Gary's Fortune then walk right around it for about 20 feet until you see a low lying boulder on your right that gradully gets taller as you walk by it, up to about 10 feet. This is the boulder your looking for and the route climbs the arete near the tree  to the height of the boulder, you will use the face that faces the trail.

content.description: This area is made up of short boulder problems, it is a good area for people who are not yet comfortable with the heights of some of the other larger boulders. Sadly this area still needs developing but there is a lot of possibilities.
